Properties.Description: Globally unique identifier for this asset.
Type of Asset to create.
Short ID unique to this asset's category.
Should texture non-power-of-two warnings be ignored?
Should read/write texture warnings be ignored?
Override which .masterbundle file this asset uses.
Indicates that this asset should skip loading from a master bundle and look for a legacy bundle instead.
Override which .unity3d file this asset uses.
Includes the file name in the bundle path, so if you have an asset that isn't in it's own folder, use this property for the correct bundle path.
Defines which asset bundle version to use for this asset's legacy bundle.
Forces the game to replace shaders on this asset's models with the known in-game shaders.
Keeps the game from replacing shaders on this asset's models with the known in-game shaders. Requires that @Asset_Bundle_Version be >= 3.
Whether or not to keep localization data loaded for this asset. This is used to make sure NPC hints are translated on the client and not shown in the server's language.

Values.Description: Applies conditional logic to the player's current experience.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current reputation.
Compares the value of a flag to the value '1'.
Compares the value of a flag to a signed 16-bit integer.
Applies conditional logic to the player's status of a given quest, such as if they've completed it or if it's in progress.
Applies conditional logic to a character's chosen skillset.
Applies conditional logic to a count of how many of a specific item a player has in their inventory.
Ensures the number of zombies a player has killed is at least a certain amount, with optional filters.
Ensures the number of times a player has completed a Horde Beacon in a location is at least a certain amount.
Ensures the number of times a player has killed a specific animal is at least a certain amount.
Applies conditional logic to two different flag values. Boolean flags will have the value 1 for true, and false for all other values.
Applies conditional logic to the number of seconds elapsed since midnight in the current day.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current health stat.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current food stat.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current water stat.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current immunity stat.
Applies conditional logic to the active holiday.
Ensures the number of times a player has killed other players is at least a certain amount.
Ensures the number of times a player has destroyed a specific object is at least a certain amount.
Applies conditional logic to the total amount of a type of currency a player has on them.
Ensures the number of times a player has destroyed a specific resource is at least a certain amount.
Applies conditional logic to a specific type of weather's current status.
Applies conditional logic to the percentage a specific type of weather is faded in or out.
Compares the current full moon state with the given boolean value.
Applies conditional logic to the current amount of days within a fixed interval of days.
Applies conditional logic to the player's current stamina stat.
Applies conditional logic to the number of players in an NPC overlap volume.
No logic.
Checks if some property is less than a given value.
Checks if some property is less than or equal to a given value.
Checks if some property is equal to a given value.
Checks if some property is different than a given value.
Checks if some property is greater than or equal to a given value.
Checks if some property is greater than a given value.
Quest is not currently active.
Quest is active but conditions are not met.
Quest is active and conditions are met (or there are no conditions).
Quest has been completed at least once.
'Civillian' skillset.
'Fire Fighter' skillset.
'Police Officer' skillset.
'Spec Ops' skillset.
'Farmer' skillset.
'Fisher' skillset.
'Lumberjack' skillset.
'Worker' skillset.
'Chef' skillset.
'Thief' skillset.
'Doctor' skillset.
Any zombie speciality.
Standard zombie.
Mega zombie.
Crawler zombie.
Sprinter zombie.
A flanker zombie that isn't currently invisible.
A flanker zombie that is currently invisible.
A burner zombie that spits fire.
An acid zombie that spits acid.
Electric elemental mega zombie.
Wind elemental mega zombie.
Fire elemental mega zombie.
Boss elemental mega zombie.
Magma elemental mega zombie.
Spirit zombie.
Spirit mega zombie.
Nuclear mega zombie.
Crossover from Dying Light. Only spawns during night. Explodes into fire at dawn.
Crossover from Dying Light. Only spawns during night. Explodes into fire at dawn.
Elver endgame boss with reduced bullet damage and wind zombie stomping attacks.
Kuwait final boss with increased rock throwing, damage players inside vehicle (turrets), and flashbangs.
Electric elemental boss on Buak. Buak boss types have a red-eyed flashbang effect.
Wind elemental boss on Buak. Buak boss types have a red-eyed flashbang effect.
Fire elemental boss on Buak. Buak boss types have a red-eyed flashbang effect.
Final boss on Buak. Buak boss types have a red-eyed flashbang effect.
There is currently not a holiday active.
Active from October 20th to November 1st.
Active from December 7th to January 2nd.
Active on April 1st.
Active on February 14th.
Active from June 1st to June 30th.
Active during the current Lunar New Year, which varies each year.
The weather is fading or fully faded in.
The weather is fading in.
The weather is fully faded in.
The weather is fading out.
The weather is fully faded out. This is basically the opposite of @Active.
The weather is fading in or out.
The item was gotten from the world (item spawn, etc).
The item was gotten via an admin command or similar means.
The item was crafted.
The item was found in nature, such as an animal or resource drop.
Use text as-is without formatting. For backwards compatibility.
Format flag A value into {0} and flag B value (or default) into {1}.

Properties.Description: Sets this condition back to default when met.
Defines how to compare some property with a given value.
The localization key for the 'Text' property for this condition in the localization file for this asset.
Comma-separated indexes of other conditions that must be met first before this condition will be visible in-game.
Target experience.
Target reputation.
The ID of the flag to check.
The value to compare the flag to. Note that a value of 1 is stored in the flag as 'true' and all other values are considered 'false'.
If this condition will be met if the flag has not been set.
The ID of the flag to check.
The value to compare the flag to.
If this condition will be met if the flag has not been set.
The GUID or ID of the quest to check.
The value to compare the flag to.
Allows the quest to be turned in without currently talking to an NPC.
The skillset the player must have selected to meet this condition.
The GUID or ID of the quest to check.
The GUID or ID of the quest to check.
The flag to use to track zombie kills for this condition.
Target number of zombie kills.
Type of zombie required.
Number of zombies to spawn when @Spawn is true when a player enters the referenced @Nav area.
If the zombie should automatically spawn when a player with this condition enters the navmesh referenced by @Nav.
A reference to a navmesh placed in the map editor. A value of 255 allows the zombie to be killed anywhere.
The maximum distance around players where, when a zombie is killed, it will count towards this condition. Note that the @Nav property still has to be respected. Values <= 0.1 are considered infinite.
The minimum distance away a zombie must be when its killed to count towards this condition.
ID of a zombie type shown in the level editor. This is the number listed in parenthesis in the zombie spawns tab of the map editor.
The flag to use to track horde beacons for this condition.
Target number of horde beacons completed.
A reference to a navmesh placed in the map editor.
The flag to use to track animal kills for this condition.
Target number of animal kills.
A reference to a navmesh placed in the map editor.
The left hand side flag to use to be compared in this condition.
The right hand side flag to use to be compared in this condition.
If this condition will be met if the flag for @A_ID has not been set.
If this condition will be met if the flag for @B_ID has not been set.
The target time as the number of seconds past midnight, from 0 to 86400.
The target player health from 0 to 100.
The target player food from 0 to 100.
The target player water from 0 to 100.
The target player immunity from 0 to 100.
The target holiday.
The flag to use to track player kills for this condition.
Target number of player kills.
The flag to use to track object destructions for this condition.
Target number of object destructions.
The object that needs to be destroyed.
A reference to a navmesh placed in the map editor. A value of 255 allows the object to be destroyed anywhere.
The currency type to count.
Target amount of currency.
The flag to use to track resource destructions for this condition.
Target number of resource destructions.
The resource that needs to be destroyed.
The weather type to look for.
Expected state of the expected weather.
The weather type to look for.
A percentage (0-1) of how far a weather type has transitioned in. For example: 100% when fully active, 0% when not active, somewhere in-between while transitioning in or out.
If having a full moon should satisfy this condition instead of not having one.
Target day count.
Divides the current day count by this number, then uses the remainder to compare with @Value. See the documentation for more info.
The target player stamina from 0 to 100.
The unique ID of the overlap volume (`NPCOverlapVolume`) to count players in.
The target number of players overlapping the volume referenced by @VolumeID.

Values.Description: Rewards the player with experience.
Rewards the player with reputation.
Sets a flag to a boolean (true or false) value.
Sets a flag to a signed 16-bit integer value.
Sets a flag to a random signed 16-bit integer value between two values.
Adds a quest to the player.
Gives the player one or more of a specific item.
Gives the player one or more items from a spawn table.
Gives the player a Steam achievement.
Spawns a vehicle.
Teleports the player.
Invokes an NPC event.
Applies math operations to a flag.
Gives the player currency items adding up to a specific value.
Displays a message at the bottom of the player's HUD.
Changes the location where the player will respawn next time they die.
Adds to or subtracts from the player's health.
Adds to or subtracts from the player's food.
Adds to or subtracts from the player's water.
Adds to or subtracts from the player's immunity.
Imports a separately defined Reward List asset, or a Spawn Table of reward lists.
Enables or disables 'cutscene mode' on the player, disabling the first-person view model.
Adds to or subtracts from the player's stamina.
Spawns an effect.
Spawns an airdrop at a random node or NPC spawnpoint.
Respawns zombies at NPC spawnpoint nodes.
Kills all zombies in a specified region, with an optional type filter.

Properties.Description: The localization key for the 'Text' property for this reward in the localization file for this asset.
Adds a delay to when the reward will be granted.
Indicates that the delay will be skipped and applied immediately when the player dies or disconnects.
The amount of experience to give the player.
The amount of reputation to give the player.
The ID of the flag to modify.
The value to set the flag to. Note that 'true' is 1 and all other values are 'false' (defaulting to 0).

Values.Description: Do nothing.
Set the flag to the given value, disregarding its old value.
Subtract the given value from the flag's old value.
Add the given value to the flag's old value.
Do nothing.
Set the flag to the given value or other flag, disregarding its old value.
Add the given value or other flag to the flag's old value.
Subtract the given value or other flag from the flag's old value.
Multiply the given value or other flag by the flag's old value.
Divide the flag's old value by the given value or other flag.
Set the flag to the remainder of the old flag value divided by the given value or other flag.
Set the flag to a random value between the old flag value and the given value or other flag, including both values.
Set the flag to a random value between the old flag value and the given value or other flag, including the old flag but not the new value.

Properties.Description: The ID of the flag to modify.
The value to modify the flag by.
The operation to perform on the flag.
The ID of the flag to modify.
The inclusive minimum of the range of values to modify the flag by.
The inclusive maximum of the range of values to modify the flag by.
The operation to perform on the flag.
The quest to give the player.
The item to give the player.
The number of items to spawn.
If the item should be equipped automatically if possible. Will only happen if there isn't already another item equipped.
The sight to use if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default sight.
The tactical to use if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default tactical.
The grip to use if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default grip.
The barrel to use if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default barrel.
The magazine to use if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default magazine.
The ammo count if the item is a gun, or -1 to use the default value.
The origin to spawn items with, which will change the quality and state of items when they're spawned in.
The spawn table to pull items from.
The number of items to spawn.
If the item should be equipped automatically if possible. Will only happen if there isn't already another item equipped.
The origin to spawn items with, which will change the quality and state of items when they're spawned in.
The achievement to be given to the player.
The achievement to be given to the player.
The ID of the spawnpoint node to spawn the vehicle at in the map editor.
The optional color of the vehicle.
The ID of the spawnpoint node to teleport the player to in the map editor.
Unique ID of the event to broadcast. This can be picked up by plugins or using the NPC Gloabl Event component.
This event will only be replicated to the player who triggered the interaction. Takes priority over @Replicate.
Whether or not the event is triggered on clients as well as the server.
ID of the flag to apply math to.
ID of a flag to use as an operand, the value to be applied to flag @A_ID.
Value to use as an operand, the value to be applied to flag @A_ID, if @B_ID isn't specified.
Type of operation to perform on @A_ID.
When set to 'FlagValues', formats flag A value into {0} and flag B value (or default) into {1}.
Currency type to give the player.
Amount of currency to give the player.
Message to display on the hint popup. Better to store this value in localization instead.
Number of seconds the hint will stay visible for.
The ID of the spawnpoint node to respawn the player at next time they die. Leave blank or exclude to reset the player's next spawnpoint back to a random one.
Applies a change in health to the player, either positive or negative.
Applies a change in food to the player, either positive or negative.
Applies a change in water to the player, either positive or negative.
Applies a change in immunity to the player, either positive or negative.
A refernce to a reward list asset or a spawn table containing reward lists.
Whether or not cutscene mode should be active.
Applies a change in stamina to the player, either positive or negative.
The effect to spawn.
Whether or not to spawn the effect at the target player's position.
The ID of the spawnpoint node to spawn the effect at in the map editor.
Guarantees the effect is replicated in multiplayer, where it may be skipped because of packet loss.
Overrides the default relevant distance of 128m when in multiplayer.
Whether or not only the player triggering this reward will see the effect. Takes priority over @RelevantDistance.
Whether or not to call in the airdrop at a random airdrop node placed in the editor.
Spawn table ID overriding which items to drop.
ID of a spawnpoint node to spawn the airdrop at.
Type of zombie to spawn.
ID corresponding one or more spawnpoint nodes placed in the editor to randomly spawn the zombies at.
Unique ID of a zombie type shown in the level editor. If set, the zombie spawned will use that type.
Total number of zombies to spawn.
If set, zombies will not spawn unless @CooldownDuration seconds have passed since last run. If @CooldownDuration is not set the cooldown will apply until the next restart.
When @CooldownId is set, the number of seconds that have to pass before this reward can be activated again.
Type of zombie to remove, or @NONE to remove all zombie types.
Unique ID of a zombie type shown in the level editor. If set, only zombies using this table will be removed.
A reference to a navmesh placed in the map editor where zombies will be removed from. If not set, zombies will be removed from all regions.

Values.Description: Use the default for this asset.
Uses a linearly interpolated value from 'Height_Strip' based on the current y-position of the object.
Skip this asset, and use whatever is underneath.
A concrete road larger than 16m. Uses the 1st pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
A concrete road with a width at most 16m. Uses the 3rd pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
A city street, generally used with level object streets. Uses the 2nd pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
A non-concrete road. Uses the 4th pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
A large-sized object. Uses the 16th pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
A medium-sized object. Uses the 17th pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
The level's water color. Uses the 1st pixel in 'Height_Strip'.
A cliff rock. Uses the 5th pixel in 'Layer_Strip'.
Can only be equipped from the inventory (ie. by a hotkey).
Can only be equipped from the primary (1) slot.
Can only be equipped from the secondary (2) slot.
Only used for NPCs.
Can be equipped from the primary (1) slot, secondary (2) slot, or from the inventory (ie. by a hotkey).
No physics material.
Corresponds to the 'Cloth' physics material (cfb691d917ce43799184094940ee67bb).
Corresponds to the 'Cloth' physics material (cfb691d917ce43799184094940ee67bb).

Corresponds to the 'Tile' physics material (a774706cb88d411a90fe9f0f8f575eec).

Corresponds to the 'Gravel' physics material (33650ff924b34f8d9c5a0fd97418cd3e).
Corresponds to the 'Metal_High' physics material (30eecfddde4d4192859dc7c49fc4c0db).
Corresponds to the 'Metal_Low' physics material (55ae36b285c74a57a43530ca2dd5b07f).

Corresponds to the 'Wood' physics material (31e8c91bfedd4f2fbebca6f5ca466e0f).
Corresponds to the 'Foliage' physics material (1c3a3c6664f14aa486d73528a5d9f92c).
Corresponds to the 'Foliage' physics material (1c3a3c6664f14aa486d73528a5d9f92c).

Properties.Description: The item or spawn table to spawn in. Legacy IDs will be interpreted as items.
The total amount of @Asset items to give. If @Asset is a spawn table, it will be resolved once and the same item will be given this many times.
The origin of the item, which influences the state (attachments, water/fuel level, etc.) of the item when it's spawned in.

Values.Description: Corresponds to the 'Common' (white-colored) rarity.
Corresponds to the 'Uncommon' (green-colored) rarity.
Corresponds to the 'Rare' (blue-colored) rarity.
Corresponds to the 'Epic' (purple-colored) rarity.
Corresponds to the 'Legendary' (pink-colored) rarity.
Corresponds to the 'Mythical' (red-colored) rarity.
